definition: worm-like invertebrate/mythical animal (see 獬豸[xie4 zhi4])/radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 153)

sentences.english: a tapir found in Malaya and Sumatra.
sentences.chinese: 产于马来半岛和苏门答腊岛的貘。

sentences.english: Baby tapirs have white stripes and spots, but these disappear when the animal is about seven months old.
sentences.chinese: 小貘长有白色的条纹和斑点，但是，当它长到大约。

sentences.english: The tapir's main enemies are members of the cat family, such as tigers and jaguars.
sentences.chinese: 貘的主要敌人是诸如老虎和美洲豹之类的猫科动物。

sentences.english: Tapirs are usually dark brown in color (3), with the exception of the Malay or Asian tapir.
sentences.chinese: 貘通常是深褐色，但是马来貘或称亚洲貘例外。

sentences.english: Tapirs are usually dark brown in color (3), with the exception of the Malay or Asian tapir.
sentences.chinese: 貘通常是深褐色，但是马来貘或称亚洲貘例外。

sentences.english: Tapirs are usually dark brown in color (3), with the exception of the Malay or Asian tapir.
sentences.chinese: 貘通常是深褐色，但是马来貘或称亚洲貘例外。

sentences.english: Also known as mountain danta, this animal is the smallest of the three species of tapir that exist in America
sentences.chinese: 它是美洲三种貘类当中体型最小的。

sentences.english: Like all tapirs, it has a long, flexible snout.
sentences.chinese: 它和其他所有的貘一样，它口鼻部分很长，而且灵活。

sentences.english: The tapir's snout and upper lip form a short trunk like that of the elephant (2).
sentences.chinese: 貘的口鼻部部分和上嘴唇构成一个像大象那样的象鼻。

definition: wild beast/wild horse/lion/trad. form used erroneously for 貌/simplified form used erroneously for 狻
raccoon dog (Nyctereutes procyonoides)/raccoon of North China, Korea and Japan (Japanese: tanuki)/also pr. [hao2]
